Reviews.Title: “Helpful polite staff at Aneto!”
Reviews.Author: Moyra D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: 4 nights stay at Aneto. All staff very friendly, excellent English and helpful, especially on the last night when my handbag was stolen in nearby restaurant (Carmelita's). Googled my bank to help cancel card and let me use the reception telephone as mobile also stolen in bag. THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: tjptia999
Reviews.Content: If you plan to explore Barcelona, this hotel is perfectly situated. Metres from Las Ramblas, quiet location, everything you want to see or do within walking (or tube distance). Its cheap, breakfast was included I think. Hotel is split across a few floors, and part of the building is residential. No problems with noise, was a slightly small room but we were only there to sleep for a few hours - as with any city break. Would definitely recommend this hotel, and Barcelona itself for a break away.

Reviews.Title: “My Bag Was Stolen Here”
Reviews.Author: Ramon K K
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. We had a very small room but we had our own bathroom. Only... Monday morning (March 19) we checked out of our room. After the check-out we left our bags between the other traveller bags in the reception, but after we came back to pick it up, before going to the airport, my bag was gone. The man at the reception desk could not help us out with this. He told us the camera in the reception does not record the events and no one left the hotel with a bag.

Reviews.Title: “City trip”
Reviews.Author: Remko H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a nice location, close to the Ramblas but far enough to be quiet. The hotel is clean and the reception is open 24/7. Across the street is a very nice restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Brendon D
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average size, it is comfortable. I was barely in the hotel because I was sightseeing all day/night. The staff is very nice and there is always someone at the front desk to help you. There is an elevator which is helpful for luggage. The rooms and hallways are very clean. The hotel is located only a few minutes away from the center of La Ramblas. It is also near metros which allows you to be anywhere in the city easily and quickly. It is a quick metro ride away from the beaches of Barceloneta. I was very happy with my stay here and would definitely stay in Hotel Aneto again!

Reviews.Title: “Really budget”
Reviews.Author: Luzula
Reviews.Content: Very reticent staff not spoiling you with any excessive conversation. The front desk is a desk in a common stairwell in a regular apartment building. If you want to store your luggage somewhere you just put it in the stairwell next to that desk... The staircase is dark and worn. But once up in the rooms on the second floor it is extremely fresh and clean. Like others have mentioned you can hear everything that happens in the rooms next door. I could not see any common areas. Only the rooms and the corridor. So the hotel is not suitable if you are several people and want a common place to meet within the hotel walls. The rooms are small. But they are clean and functional - and the situation is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location!”
Reviews.Author: Paipeka
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for budget hotel with excellent location you choice will be hotel Aneto! It's only 2min walk from La Rambla and well situated at the quarter of El Raval. Nice restaurants, tapas bars, bakery shops and contemporary museum just next to Aneto. Rooms are quite small and practically there are not any acoustic isolation but if you don't mind don't hesitate to book!

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel in exellent location”
Reviews.Author: stevedgal
Reviews.Content: the hotel aneto is situated in a rustic buiding on the second floor all the rooms have recently been renovated they are very clean and well serviced daily most are ensuite with tv there is some building work going on near by but it is very quiet the ramblas plaza catallunya main barcelona market are all two minutes walk away next door to the aneto are pleny of good cafes and eating houses all in all a very nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: carmen1403
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellant value for money and very clean. The Aneto is simple and offers a very simple pastries, tea or coffee for breakfast. It's ideal for a city break, minutes away from Las Ramblas, with restaurants, bars and shops on your doorstep. 24 hrs reception, friendly staff. Safe boxes are available to rent. Hot water always available and this year aircondition was an added bonus. Downside were the noisy selfish guests who do not seem to realise that there are other guests in the hotel that were perahaps asleep. But this is not the fault of the hotel. If you are on a tight budget, but want a simple, clean and place to stay with a great location then I can highly recommend the Aneto.

Reviews.Title: “Good option close to Placa de Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: MarcEnRoute
Reviews.Content: Positive: it's 3 minutes off the Ramblas de Catalunya and under 10 minutes from Placa de Catalunya. Given that location it's not very expensive. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. I found the overall atmosphere pleasant and safe. Neither good or bad: I had room 117 which is a single room with an external bathroom down the hall. Bathroom is private and neat, but not attached to the room. Breakfast is sweet pre-packaged cakes and tea/coffee from the machine next to the room. Negative: That particular room smells like it's been the territory of heavy smokers for decades and it has no daylight. My advice: if you need a hotel close to Ramblas/Pl.Catalunya this is an excellent option. The rest of the hotel gave me a much better impression than the room I had. If you're in this single room with exterior bathroom limit your stay to 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: Andosan
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is just off las rambles about two blocks. This makes it pretty convenient but Yhe hotel is a little older and be prepared on the elevator might surprise you a little. Overall good deal, decent size room with safe , tv and air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service!”
Reviews.Author: 528795Linda
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel; fantastic location but when we were the subject of a robbery at the port resulting in our passports and money stolen; the receptionist, Carlos was absolutely brilliant, making phone calls to ensure we could fly and even giving us money to get to the airport and even have a snack and drink! Without his help, we would have never got home, and we can't thank the hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “For Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: LuisFelipeR
Reviews.Content: Aneto is a very simple hotel. The location is perfect: it is very well located close to the Ramblas and Catalunya Square. Only 20 minutes walking from the beach. Room and bath was cleaned every day. There is no breakfast but hot Coffee and some cakes and "magdalenas" served for free. If you are a budget traveller and are looking for a cheap but nice place to sleep with no frills, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RigaLaura
Reviews.Content: i was there with mother (60 years), we both loved this place. The room was perfect, location perfect and view from window - amazing - to small square. the breakfast little bit strange - poor - just coffee and cakes at the hotel hall. after third day...it was enought of cakes and we prefer to go for breakfast to nearest market. it wasn`t big problem. nice hotel for good price. we have the best memories about hotel and Barcelona, if i will visit Barca again i will choose the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: rbbrno
Reviews.Content: Excellent location few steps from Rambla. Clean room. Wake up service working without problems. Helpful receptionist. Free wifi. Possibility to use air conditioning. You can have a small snack and coffee for breakfest.

Reviews.Title: “Not Even Worth the Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: jwire4
Reviews.Content: Luckily, I only stayed for one night, but that one night was the worst of my 8 day stay in Spain. Read other reviews carefully, I did before I left and they are right, The location of the hotel is very sketchy. It's on a very busy street night and day. The noise is awful, there is construction happening across the street, and people are out very late, and it is very loud. As other reviews stated, the walls are paper thin. They are spot on. You can not only hear toilets and showers, but full on conversations. I woke up numerous times during the night to clearly here people talking in the hallway, closes doors, and talking in their room. Also, be prepared to drag your luggage up multiple levels of stairs. They have a very small service elevator. I honestly wouldn't get in the thing, it looked very unstable. You have no other choice then to carry your luggage up stairs, and the first floor of rooms is 3 floors up. You have a long way up, especially when dragging luggage. The room was clean, but that was the only thing is had going for it. We had a 2 bed room, and it was very small. There was an AC unit above the door, but it didn't work, and none of the staff spoke English, and they couldn't get it either. The window was broken, and looked out to other apartments. Even for the cheap price, I would never stay here again. It is central, but "too central". Sketchy street, very busy, loud- I knew I wouldn't be a bit surprised to come back and have something stolen from the room. Honestly, if you like taking chances and being in the action, more power to you. But for me, even spending just a few hours there, I'd never stay agin.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: axxmy
Reviews.Content: excellent location close to la rambla. a quick left and right will get you anywhere in barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaybargain
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed here for 2 nights as we explored Barcelona. Excellent location right next to Las Ramblas and the taxi driver found it from the airport no problem. The rooms are good enough and are cleaned daily. It was exactly what we required at the end of the day, Cheap and location wise spot on!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is just great!”
Reviews.Author: GeZgiN42
Reviews.Content: This hotel requires all of your basic needs. The room we stayed was very small but cosy we liked it a lot. We had an exterior private bathroom. They cleaned the room and the bathroom everyday. Although it was pretty close to La Rambla street, which is packed with people for most of the time, the hotel was very quiet and and relaxing The value was really great!

Reviews.Title: “Location was fantastic, but walls are thin.”
Reviews.Author: Mach13 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Location is superb a few minutes from the Ramblas. Reception were efficient and the rooms were a fair standard and no issues with cleanliness. Value was exceptional and the locale although not the best had several good restaurants walking away from the Ramblas. My comment on the walls being thin related to the fact there was a group making a lot of noise in neighbouring rooms late at night. Free breakfast included a coffee machine and some sweet confectionary which did not suit. The coffee was a nice start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this hotel -- beware of reservation scam!!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck3134
Reviews.Content: I have not visited this hotel, but I made the mistake of booking a reservation on the hotel's website. I booked 5 months in advance and then had to cancel a few days later as our plans had changed. The reservations site has a list of conditions which are written in confusing language with conflicting clauses. The bottom line however, is that one of their conditions is that a cancellation at any time will result in a charge for one night's stay or 1/2 of the cost of the booking (if booked for 3 days or more). It looks like I am out some $ even though I cancelled months in advance. Beware and don't make this mistake!! Do not deal with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best for short trip on budget”
Reviews.Author: Enya27
Reviews.Content: For money we paid it was fantastic- very clean with very nice cleaning lady, 24 h entrance, great location( although was difficult to find -even 2 taxi drivers didnt know it by name, and in night time there is a security doors front at it, so you cant see the sign board!) The room also was nice with many drawers, and free coffee in morning was just the thing we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sunsetrelax
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aneto Hotel for 7 nights. It was me, my husband and our 2 1/2 year old child. The hotel was very central, in a side street to the Ramblas. I found it ideal for us as just infont of the hotel there is a playing field, a mini market where I could find lactose free milk for my child. (I couldn't find it in pharmacies but they had it in that mini market) The hotel isn't fancy at all, but very convenient for who wants to see the city and use it to take a shower and sleep. I already knew about the noise problem so I was prepared with ear plugs but never had to use them as the room was on the back side of the hotel. Only one night we had some problems with the neighbouring room as a group of young french students came that night and made a lot of noise until they settled down until 2am!!! As for the rest it was all ok. They had a small fridge at the reception which we could use for our milk. Only found out about it on our last 2 nights! All in all i recommend this hotel for any body who is there to see the city and not to relax in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jacomien
Reviews.Content: I'm a 25 year old girl and spent a weekend in September alone in Barcelona. I was a bit resistant to book into a hostel as you never know who you might end up in the room with! So, Hotel Aneto was the next cheap option. I read reviews on Tripadvisor and the overall comment of this hotel was quite negative. Well, I experienced it very differently :) The staff was friendly and very helpful; the room was very clean and had everything you need and expect for the price you pay. The bathroom is not en-suite, but right next to the room and it was clean an private. The location of the hotel is perfect. 3 minutes walk from the bustling Las Ramblas and there are a few nice restaurants and shops on the same street as the hotel. I can definately recommend this for someone travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “nasty and unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jackiHobart
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked a room for 4 days and it was secured with a credit card. After a series of disasters with eurorail she turned up a day late, understandably the room had been let out to someone else, HOWEVER, Manuel on reception told her that he had no rooms available for her and she wouldn't get anywhere else to stay as it was so late at night, he was deliberately rude, nasty and unhelpful. She found somewhere else to stay without the awful Manuel's help and asked if she could get a taxi. Manuel would not call her a taxi and told her to find one on the street. This is after they've charged her for a room and also let it out to someone else. My daughter is a teenager, who has never travelled overseas before, was in a strange country and didn't speak the language. Manuel's unnecessarily rude and arrogant behaviour made a bad situation a disaster. I rang the hotel to tell them i was unimpressed with the staff, they informed me they didn't have a manager( no wonder it's so badly run!!) and i was not able to speak to Manuel to voice my concerns, I did speak to Carlos however who told me it wasn't his problem and chuckled when i told him that my daughter had been frightened, in tears and unsure of where to go. If you are the guardian or carer of anyone vulnerable make sure you do not book them into this hotel, as the staff treat young girls with distaste and malice.

Reviews.Title: “Contemptious service”
Reviews.Author: bajzelj
Reviews.Content: I was treated with the utmost contempt at this hotel, I was hardley even looked at and when I arrived I found that my room had been given away and there were no more rooms. The man who worked at reception (manuel -refused to give me his name and I only found out through the further complaint of family memebers) gave little reason for why my room had been given and none reasonable, I recieved no notification from the hotel of not having accommodation though they had 2 contact numbers and an email address. I had been traveling for 2 days and it was late at night so of course I was not in a particularly happy mood on finding this information. The man did not offer me a seat though I had a pack on my back and he was aware I was trying to find alternative accommodation. My aunt called and wished to speak with him, he put the phone down on her. On leaving the hotel to find a taxi (he refused to call one) I also discovered it to be in the red light district! So although angry at not being able to have my room and at being treated so horribly I was glad not to be staying in that area and was very angry he had not called a taxi and there fore made me walk through such an area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aneto refunded the costs!!”
Reviews.Author: saarie
Reviews.Content: After my complaint at their website and on tripadvisor about not refunding my reservation when I cancelled 13 days before arrival, I received a message that they REFUNDED the money. So, that is CORRECT, but take care, ask them your rights before you make a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “they cheated me. and were rude”
Reviews.Author: derrida22
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on line. There was nothing on the site that said non-refundable. So when I found a cheaper place 230 minutes later, I called the hotel. They told me "too bad." Had they been at all pleasant, I would have shrugged my shoulders and said "OK." But instead, I called my credit card company and filed a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: misschloe2
Reviews.Content: Had little problem finding the hotel but once found was ok. down a side street off the las ramblas really good location. close to everything, the reception area was ok, but walking up to the rooms for the first time was a bit scarey as it was so dark and a bit dowdy. once passed the hallway it was nice and bright, found the room was really ok what we paid for, had everything you need apart from a fridge.We stayed bed and breakfast we didn't know what to expect it was cakes and a vending machines of hot drinks but that was ok as we enjoyed the cakes!!! overall i think if you want somewhere cheap to stay that is nice i would stay here again good value for the location .

Reviews.Title: “wots ya problem”
Reviews.Author: MikeCornish
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old son,his girlfriend and myself stayed at this hotel for 2 nights to go to a Rammstein concert. The hotel was just finishing facia restoration when we arrived.Our rooms were spotless and quite adequate for a few nights stay.Breakfast was not included but a free hot drinks machine operates in the corridor in the morning (along with some wrapped doughnuts if you were desperate).The hotel was close to the Ramblas and the red light district (and all the sad people who inhabit it)--walking the wrong way down the street is not recommended.If you cant take this then go to Disneyland instead of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided at all costs”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjoBristol_uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aneto is 50 meters off Las Ramblas, down a dirty narrow street that has most buildings boarded up, only the knife shop and the gun shop open during the day. The hotel is no more than one floor of an apartment block that has been converted into cells. The walls are so thin you can hear every word spoken in most nearby rooms and you can certainly hear all toilet visits and bowel movements.We had to fend off a mugging attempt outside the hotel at 11:30 on the first night and then listen to the guy in the next room on the loo all night. The continental breakfast is a free vend coffee machine and a tray of dried up pasteries. We paid 67 Euros a night for four nights, but after the first night we left and booked into a Four star hotel just off Placia de Catalunya for only 99 euros. a night. Take my advise and steer well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to sing about but nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: SaleDamc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week and found the hotel to be perfectly adequate, without being spectacular. The hotel is still being rennovated so there is scaffolding on the front but I did not have a room at the front so it was of no consequence, to me. My room was on the small side but had ample storage space and a TV but without English channels but I didn't go to Barcelona to watch TV. The only issue I had was that the bed was a bit squeaky but after a long day sightseeing and a few cold Estrella's I had no trouble sleeping. There was no bathroom in my room but I had a key to my own, private bathroom no more than 5 yards down the hallway. Previous reports, regarding the lift, were correct. It was built around 1900, I reckon! Overall, if I was staying in Barcelona for a week then I would probably chose another, slightly more comfortable hotel but for a couple of nights, as it was, last week and with it's location just 100 yards from Las Ramblas, I would quite happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not much better than hostel”
Reviews.Author: cathys997
Reviews.Content: Always looking for the best value, I read the reviews for this hotel and thought I'd give it a try. It was rated a 1 star and it is a 1 star hotel. There is only a small dreary lobby with check-in desk. You have to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs to get to an elevator that barely holds 1 person and 1 bag. The path to our room was lined with laundry bags to be washed. Our room had a bathroom which was clean, but many of the rooms shared the bathroom. Two twin beds were flanked by 1950's end tables on bare floors. The room was clean, but if you want anything more, this is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: samiam1980
Reviews.Content: The Aneto is clean and in a very central location but other then that it is not somewhere I would stay again. The rooms are what you would expect at a hostile and there was a man jack hammering outside my bedroom till 8pm. I paid 88 euros for this room, which seems much overpriced considering we stayed at the Hotel Casanova for the following days of our trip, for 120 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: WaGlobetrotter19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and although the location was pretty ideal, a short walk to La Rambla, I had a devastating stay at this hotel. Upon my stay I was sexually assaulted by the hotel's very own staff. The man working the front desk pushed his way into our room and forced himself on me. My screaming brought no other attention and upon emailing the hotel about this incident, they did nothing. The response I got was essentially that they are sorry that happened to me but that there is absolutely nothing they could do. They eventually stopped emailing me back all together. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone of my friends or family members. On a side note, the rooms are a little pricey for what you get. Overall I regret my stay with this hotel and will never return or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Worcestershirelass3
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a four-night stay at the Hotel Aneto. As a budget hotel it provided us with very clean en-suite accommodation, air conditioning (which was very welcome) and a lift, which although a bit shaky, saved us walking up several flights of stairs. Breakfast, as others have written, was a little odd, but the hotel is so close to the cafes of the La Rambla and the wonderful market of de la Bouqueria, a more substantial breakfast can easily be found. Would definitely recommend this hotel for its location, price, cleanliness. If you can look past the scaffolding, the thinness of the walls and the graffitti on the street (which is endemic in Barcelona) you should enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's all Aneto has going for it!!!”
Reviews.Author: SJ_likes_to_travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hoetl Aneto with my friend for a long weekend in the last week of July. We arrived at the hotel only to find that the entire building covered in scaffolding. The hotel doesn't actually occupy the entire building just one floor in a building that houses apartments and businesses, which for me was a little odd. The room was small but I must say it was clean however there was no real window. our room looked on to more a brick wall and was blocked in so we had no fresh air and could only rely on the air con. There were not even any windows in the corridor of the hotel so once you entered it we could not see outside at all!! The breakfast is ridiculous, its just some dry cakes in packets and a vending machine that you have to buy coffee from yourself!! Plus they turn it off at 11am. The staff which consisted of two blokes that alternated on a desk were indifferent. Not particularly helpful, but not rude either. I know you get what you pay for and this is a really cheap hotel. If you are going to stay here then make sure you only come back late at night and preferably when you are drunk! On the positive, the location is fantastic.....We hardly took the metro at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: robyness
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Aneto in April for 5 nights and found the hotel to be great. The first night we were in a family room with loads of space but were shifted to a double room for the rest of our stay which was fine. Beds were a little uncomfortable but the bathroom was good (shower over bath). The staff were very helpful. Location was terrific. Street led out onto Las Ramblas with a Metro stop only a few metres away. Close to good restaurants as well. Free coffee from the machine in the morning as well. Bit of a crazy lift...hold on when it takes off!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,"ok" for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Gio
Reviews.Content: Centrally located adjacent to the famous Rambla which is a major plus for this venue. Some of the staff at the front desk are very helpful and friendly. Our room was big enough with spacious closets. The bathroom was small but functional. The elevator needs an urgent upgrade. We were satisfied for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: FamilleMartin
Reviews.Content: Our reception at 6pm on a weekday could hardly have been less auspicious. The front desk was unmanned and, despite wandering around several floors, we succeeded in rousing not a single living soul. We had to resort to telephoning the hotel by mobile from within the hotel itself in order to check in. Payment in advance on arrival speaks volumes about the hotel and its clientele. All that said, our room, when we eventually got to it, was both comfortable and spotlessly clean. The air conditioning and heating systems worked well and our en-suite bathroom was spacious and well-equipped. If earth-shattering noise and loud, animated, interminable conversations right outside your bedroom door in the small hours are not your cup of tea, then the Aneto is not the place for you. In 30+ years of staying in hotels, I have only once been to somewhere nioisier than the Aneto. However, the hotel does have the merit of being smack in the centre of Barcelona, with all the sights easily accessible on foot. It is also inexpensive and everything considered, reasonable value for money for a short stay. Would we return to the Aneto or recommend it to others? Certainly not, even if we were paid to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Strumfica
Reviews.Content: We staid at this hotel for 5 nights and it was a very pleasant experience. We were prepared for 1 star hotel conditions, but we were very happy to find much more. The rooms are very clean, the bathroom also. The beds are made daily and the towels changed every day. We didn't had problems with the heat in the rooms by night, it was very warm. The location is perfect, you can get to any central part of the city or shopping area by foot. Also the subway is very close. A nice detail is the Boqueria market where you can buy fresh fruits and juice in the morning for breakfast at very good prices. The only part not so good with the hotel is that you can hear every move from the hotel and street. This is a problem that I've heard it exists in all the old buildings near Rambla. So if you have problems sleeping , I would recommend to choose a hotel in a new building with good isolation. But if you don't have problems waking up at 8 am and you only want a clean, nice place to sleep at night this is the perfect choice for a great budget.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aneto
HotelInfo.Address: Carme 38, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
